intro: Anisifolium gabunense, commonly known as the Gabon aniseleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, achene-like seeds. Anisifolium gabunense is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
